medical_history.chief_complaint: Weakness of muscles and clinical seizures.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Muscle weakness was noted at age 2 years. Clinical seizures developed at 1 year of age, with seizure types including twitching movements, starting episodes, cluster seizures, and spasms. At 1.5 years, there was only partial response to anti-convulsive therapy. By age 2, global developmental delay was noted, with no speech and the need for assistance with daily activities.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Vigorous in the newborn period, passed newborn disease screening, began walking at 18 months.
medical_history.family_history: Parents do not have a personal history of seizures, and there is no family history of seizures.
